intro: Crassula tetragona subsp. tetragona, commonly known as the Four-angled Crassula, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features thick, fleshy leaves arranged in a distinctive four-sided, columnar shape. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the growing season. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water. Its compact growth habit makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and container planting.
